settings.title: George Krastev
settings.text:
Founder and CEO

George Krastev (Georgi Krastev) is originally from Europe and started VoltBike Electric Inc. in 2013 as a side project at his home garage in Coquitlam, BC, Canada. 7 years later, that side project has become a profitable, self-funded company with thousands of riders around North America.

Prior to VoltBike he was a successful web developer for various e-commerce companies the most significant of which is Best Buy Canada. He has a masterâ€™s degree in computer science and technology. He lives in Vancouver, BC with his wife and two daughters.

settings.title: Atta Dimitrova
settings.text:
Assistant Manager

Atta is valuable team member with many years of work experience in administration and customer relations sectors. No matter how tense a meeting, she effortlessly leaves everyone with a smile. She has a great ability to handle pressure and sudden deadlines.

Atta will be your go to person when you have issues, and she will make sure to resolve them as per your satisfaction.

settings.title: Erin Altstadt
settings.text:
Customer Relations Specialist

Erin joined the VoltBike team to meet the demand for the 2020 season. Holding down the customer support lines, Erin is essential part of our team. You can typically find her swimming, working out, and soon to be out on the trail with the rest of the VoltBike crew!

settings.title: Momchil Kutev
settings.text:
Web & Graphic Designer

Momchil splits his time between web development, product photography, and the design of marketing materials. In his spare time, he likes going for bike rides, taking photos, spending time with family and friends, and checking up on the Canucks.

settings.text:

Momchil splits his time between web development, product photography, and the design of marketing materials. In his spare time, he likes going for bike rides, taking photos, spending time with family and friends, and checking up on the Canucks.

settings.title: Bernard Henze
settings.text:
Bike Mechanic

Bicycle Bernie joins our team with over 30 years of bicycle maintenance and assembly expertise. During the 80's and 90's, he was one of Richmond's "go-to-guys" if you required any kind of assistance associated with your bicycle.

He also brings valuable experience in customer service and sales, and is very much looking forward to getting his hands dirty with your VoltBike!

settings.title: Pedro Bitero
settings.text:
Bike Mechanic

Momchil splits his time between web development, product photography, and the design of marketing materials. In his spare time, he likes going for bike rides, taking photos, spending time with family and friends, and checking up on the Canucks.

VoltBike's main distribution center is a brand new warehouse facility and is located in Port Coquitlam, BC, Canada. From this location, we serve entire Canada and ship bicycles and parts every day. Situated with 2x loading docks our warehouse is able to receive and ship at the same time more than a dozen bikes per day. This location is also open for test rides, repairs and service and also local pickups.

Unlike other companies on the market, at VoltBike we store all bikes in-house making sure the bike is available at the time of the order. This allow us to provide better customer experience and you wait less for your bike to arrive.
